Lawrence, and Obergefell
rulings protect
contraception, same-sex
relationships, and same-sex marriage. And the court is suggesting they be reconsidered. Reallllly scary. https://t.co/gDWXzdR60k

Speechless.  Striking down Roe v. Wade will have devastating repercussions for so many people.  This decision is a slippery slope. What next? If you have the funds, consider giving to https://t.co/ayj3kKeh9e or https://t.co/tM6mL3KzZE

We‚Äôre excited to be a part of @tiktok_us Pride! Check out this playlist featuring some of our favorite new and old songs from LGBTQ+ artists. Use one in your videos to celebrate #PrideMusic with us :) https://t.co/cZ4Dc1MDHg

Our first big placement ever was Where Does The Good Go in the first season of Grey's Anatomy back in 2005.  It's still one of our biggest songs 17 years later for that reason.  A great placement can bring a new audience to a band whether they are brand new, or established!

Thank you @amazonmusic for making us Artist of the Month!!¬† We cannot WAIT to drop another new song soon. We are so grateful for all the early support of our new music.¬† Don‚Äôt forget to go listen to our song Fucking Up What Matters. Link in bio! https://t.co/cGs78PnbSG
I‚Äôm the age where you go for a walk after dinner.

The wonderful @Vans also funded our #LGBTQ Summer Camperships program! This is @teganandsarafdn  longest-running program, it supports LGBTQ+ summer camps in the U.S. and Canada.  Thank you to Vans for making so many young LGTBQ+ people's dream of attending camp happen this year!

Couldn't be more proud or thrilled to be partnered with @Vans this year at @teganandsarafdn !!! With their help, we did a round of funding for our Trans Youth Community Grants program, which supports amazing organizations uplifting Trans youth.  Thanks, @Vans ‚ù§Ô∏è

My favorite part of our substack is reading comments on our posts, but also posting Sara and I's text conversations.  These ones are from our latest post about when I got Covid. I told Sara I had taken one advil and one tylenol. Her response, I take three advil for a hangover. üòÇ https://t.co/8o6IEBSuzw

Remember when we used to hang out socially distanced? And the chronic hives I got in early Feb 2020 that I swear were a weird COVID symptom?? All those memories came flooding back when I got COVID (officially) for the first time a few weeks ago. Read more: https://t.co/sYmzKSMDQj
for the record, she's never pooped in the house. which is what makes it so funny. https://t.co/ZTipxmq5tL

i never wanted a dog, but my gf was desperate for one.  the dog ruined our lives (in the best way).  she just turned two and i love her. but to get back at my gf from time to time i yell "oh no she pooped" when i go upstairs and wait for my gf to come running. and it feels great.

This is my @Bartees_Strange and @whereisMUNA appreciation tweet of the day! Both have tours heading out soon with incredible support and new albums either just out or about to come out, and you should love them if you don't already. Thank you bye. https://t.co/0VoPUdLjvg

If you‚Äôre not interested in paying, you can always become an unpaid subscriber so you get notified every time we post. You‚Äôll get a bunch of new content every week and it‚Äôs FREE! Come join the conversation!

Today on Substack our mom dropped some beautiful insights for paid subscribers. If you‚Äôre interested in reading about the biggest lesson she‚Äôs learned in her many decades on this planet and how she became her own hero, become a paid subscriber! https://t.co/tbfQ9xmWBd

Our cousin Jen sent us this, and I find it very funny, but also, Sara and I actually DID have a basketball net when we were 12-14 years old and were on the basketball team in junior high. In grade nine, Sara scored 19 points in one game. We lost, but Sara was a winner that day. https://t.co/JDDkDQ1Nls

i'm sitting down to rehearse songs for tour. a tour we haven't yet announced.  one that is still months away.  but the new me prepares in advance. what songs should we play on the tour that has yet to be announced? give me inspiration in the comments. please don't say, superstar.

Happy Pride! I've been resting a bit lately, and it's been unusually wet and cold here, so what better time to stay indoors or sit under a wool blanket on my deck and READ! My second book review is up on our Substack! TRQ READS TOO! PRIDE EDITION! https://t.co/GrJq5eh8Bo

Scheduled, structured exercise in groups has never been my thing. I enjoy running alone. I also like being outdoors. Sara has recently expressed an interest in exercise. I encourage her to follow her fitness dreams in my latest Substack. https://t.co/jb3Fc0CV00

Tegan called me out last week for referring to us as old. But I say it as positive not negative. We‚Äôre older, wiser, and more experienced than we once were, and I think that is what‚Äôs reflected in our new music. Read my take on age on Substack today. https://t.co/F4Jw1TVvD6

Sara is always calling us old. I've started to do it too.   I know we are getting older, but inside I still feel  19 (call me). Having an identical twin is like having a mirror with you all the time.  I chart the changes in my face, on hers. Read about it: https://t.co/G5RJCSf8ls

I answered questions on Substack this week. Subscribe to be in the community! You get to ask questions and we answer them! We share things like photos, personal stories, tease new music, annotate lyrics, etc! Subscribe for free, or get more for $6/month. https://t.co/aoOyHdcocD

@tomberlin Hiiiiii. Trust me if we were Vancouver we‚Äôd be already looking in the windows.  But we‚Äôre in Calgary. You‚Äôre gonna have a great time though Wise Hall is amazing! And your record is üò≠‚ù§Ô∏èüî•

Feels like a lot of people like the black or the blue. If you had to choose between the two which one would you choose? For the record I‚Äôm leaning towards blue. We‚Äôve never done that color before. And Sara‚Äôs partner Stacy chose it!

Sara drew this for me as a joke. But then I got it tattooed on myself. Who‚Äôs laughing now!?  Let us know which color you like best in the comments and that‚Äôs the shirt we‚Äôre gonna make next. https://t.co/QLifPaw2Un
Also this new @muna song is great. Thank goodness for their goodness.

No one needs an AR-15.  No one. It makes no sense that civilians have high powered riffles in their possession. Whatever age. None. There is 1 reason why mass murder doesn‚Äôt happen in other countries with the regularity it happens in America and that‚Äôs it. https://t.co/WfTUdqo7ku

I would consider ourselves sleepwalkers in our adolescent years, but since then, I‚Äôve struggled to disappear into the dark void that is REM sleep. Here in Calgary, that's changed and I'm finally starting to associate rest with work. Isn't that amazing!?  https://t.co/4r1x2z8dkN

I‚Äôve been traveling & listening to music more. I like listening to music on planes or in the car. Having a soundtrack when entering a new city helps me orient myself & soften the arrival. Come tell me what songs I should add to my playlist on Substack. https://t.co/zrPlJGQ6Bg

üíî Heartbroken at this news. Urvashi was a truly wonderful person.  Her contributions to this world were remarkable and mighty. She was so kind and generous to us when we met. Sending love to everyone in her orbit, and love and strength to her partner Kate.

I encouraged Sara to respond to my driving post on  I think we‚Äôre alone now with her own reasons for why she doesn‚Äôt drive. Subscribe to see posts like this 2 to 3 times a week! Have a nice weekend.

I admit that at 41 I feel a bit self-conscious admitting that I don‚Äôt drive. It‚Äôs a choice. But to most it‚Äôs a strange one. Surprisingly I do find myself behind the wheel from time to time. Mostly legally.
I can think of dozens of reasons not to drive but only three to get my license. If you don‚Äôt have a drivers license tell me why in the comments. https://t.co/Au2e9HhkkQ
